question.questionA: Leaflets with main lateral veins reaching the margin, often dentate.
question.questionB: Leaflets  with  main  lateral   veins  branching  before  the  margin,  not dentate, sometimes very small or reduced to a spine.

question.questionA: Plants glandular-hairy, at least above.
question.questionB: Plants not glandular-hairy.

question.questionA: Filaments of  stamens  all  fused  into  a  tube;  fruit straight or slightly curved.
question.questionB: Nine filaments fused into tube, one free; fruit falcate or coiled.

question.questionA: Perennials.
question.questionB: Annuals.

question.questionA: Plants almost hairless; flowers purple or blue.
question.questionB: Plants covered in a dense white tomentum; flowers yellow.

question.questionA: Pod sickle- or bean-shaped, black when ripe.
question.questionB: Pod in a spiral of one or more turns.

question.questionA: Pod without spines.
question.questionB: Pod with spines.

question.questionA: Pod glandular-pubescent, not flattened.
question.questionB: Pod glabrous, flattened.

question.questionA: Peduncles shorter than petioles.
question.questionB: Peduncles equalling or exceeding petioles.

question.questionA: Stipules deeply dentate.
question.questionB: Stipules more or less entire.

question.questionA: Pod glabrous.
question.questionB: Pod hairy.

question.questionA: Fruit ellipsoid with short broad spines.
question.questionB: Fruit globular or cylindrical with slender spines.

question.questionA: Fruit globular.
question.questionB: Fruit cylindrical.

question.questionA: Leaflets obcordate or triangular, unspotted, less than 10 mm wide.
question.questionB: Leaflets obovate, each usually bearing a dark blotch, up to 25 mm wide.

question.questionA: Leaflets up to 25 mm wide; fruit 4-9 mm in diameter, bearing hooked spines.
question.questionB: Leaflets no more than 10 mm wide; fruit 4-6 mm in diameter, spines if present slightly curved.

question.questionA: Peduncles aristate; fruit cylindrical, sparsely villous, spines curved.
question.questionB: Peduncles not aristate; fruit globose to ellipsoid, glandular-hairy, spines straight.

question.questionA: Fruit 12 mm or more in diameter, ovoid; spines needle-like.
question.questionB: Fruit 7-10 mm, globose to ellipsoid, spines broadly conical.

question.questionA: At  least  some of  the petal   claws  fused  to  the  stamen  tube;  corolla persistent in fruit.
question.questionB: Petal claws never fused to stamen tube; corolla not persistent in fruit.

question.questionA: Filaments of at least five stamens swollen at apex.
question.questionB: Filaments all slender.

question.questionA: Pod coiled in one or more turns of a spiral.
question.questionB: Pod straight or curved.

question.questionA: Pod with a prominent beak at the tip.
question.questionB: Pod not beaked.

question.questionA: Pod oblong or curved.
question.questionB: Pod oval to globular.

question.questionA: Raceme shorter than subtending leaf.
question.questionB: Raceme as long or longer than subtending leaf.

question.questionA: Pod globose.
question.questionB: Pod tapering to a point.

question.questionA: Standard petal shorter than keel petal.
question.questionB: Standard no shorter than keel.

question.questionA: Pod transversely ridged.
question.questionB: Pod concentrically striate.

question.questionA: Leaflets broad, rounded at the tip; racemes lax; corolla 6 mm or more; pod 5-6 mm, with prominent reticulate veins.
question.questionB: Leaflets narrow, tapering to a point; racemes dense; corolla 2-3 mm; pod 2-3 mm, reticulate veins not prominent.

question.questionA: Plant spiny.
question.questionB: Plant not spiny.

question.questionA: Calyx tubular with five short teeth, the upper portion breaking away and leaving a cup-like remnant.
question.questionB: Upper part of calyx not breaking away.

question.questionA: Calyx with five equal teeth or two-lipped and the upper lip not deeply divided.
question.questionB: Calyx two-lipped, the upper lip deeply divided into two.

question.questionA: Plant not spiny (appears in 37 below).
question.questionB: Plant spiny.

question.questionA: Spines straight; wing petals narrow, at least as long as keel.
question.questionB: Spines curved; wing petals broad, shorter than keel.

question.questionA: Leaves simple or with one leaflet, sometimes very small.
question.questionB: At least some leaves trifoliate.

question.questionA: Annuals.
question.questionB: Shrubs or woody based perennial herbs.

question.questionA: Leaves linear, grass-like; pod splitting.
question.questionB: Leaves obovate or elliptic; pod not splitting.

question.questionA: Calyx spathe-like, split to the base.
question.questionB: Calyx neither spathe-like nor split to the base.

question.questionA: Calyx more or less tubular; pod included within persistent calyx.
question.questionB: Calyx campanulate; pod longer than calyx or calyx not persisting.

question.questionA: Leaflets dotted with conspicuous glands; plant smelling of tar.
question.questionB: Leaflets without conspicuous glands; plant not smelling of tar.

question.questionA: Pod splitting at transverse joints.
question.questionB: Pod not splitting transversely.

question.questionA: Annual or perennial herbs.
question.questionB: Trees or shrubs.

question.questionA: Calyx  inflated, 4-6 mm wide  in  flower, up  to 12 mm wide  in  fruit, enclosing pod.
question.questionB: Calyx less than 4 mm wide, not inflated.

question.questionA: Keel petal dark red or black.
question.questionB: Keel petal neither dark nor black.

question.questionA: Stamens monadelphous; stipules not fused to petiole.
question.questionB: Stamens diadelphous; stipules fused to base of petiole.

question.questionA: Pod included in the persistent  calyx;  calyx teeth five, more or less equal.
question.questionB: Pod longer than calyx or calyx deciduous; calyx two-lipped.

question.questionA: Calyx tube distinctly shorter than lips.
question.questionB: Calyx tube as long as or longer than the lips.
